definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
plain/informal/suitable/convenient/opportune/to urinate or defecate/equivalent to 就[jiu4]: then/in that case/even if/soon afterwards
plain/informal/suitable/convenient/opportune/to urinate or defecate/equivalent to 就[jiu4]: then/in that case/even if/soon afterwards

sentences.english: As more entertainment in the evening before their early 30's, he appears to have potbellied .
sentences.chinese: 因爲晚上應酬多，才30出頭的他已經顯得大腹便便。

sentences.english: What's left is a pudgy belly that you do not have the motivation to lose.
sentences.chinese: 留下的只是大腹便便的你，而你沒有動力去減掉它。

sentences.english: Potbellied , middleaged man still can be used " rich voice " cover up a scandal, where is woman?
sentences.chinese: 大腹便便，中年男人還可以用“富態”遮羞，女人呢？

sentences.english: That big-bellied fellow was very cruel and greedy.
sentences.chinese: 那個大腹便便的傢伙既貪婪又殘惡。

sentences.english: He was a heavy man, paunchy, with a lined, kind face.
sentences.chinese: 他是個大腹便便的胖子，長着皺紋的臉很和善。
大腹便便是可以遺傳的嗎？

sentences.english: They were all rather well fed, with big tummies and delicate hands.
sentences.chinese: 他們都喫得非常好，大腹便便，雙手也很嬌嫩。

sentences.english: The pregnant woman has an enlarged abdomen.
The researchers found that dementia was more common in those with wider bellies .
sentences.chinese: 研究員們發現癡呆症在那些大腹便便的人中更常見。

definition: robust and prosperous (a compliment in former times)/fat person (modern)
back of a tiger and waist of a bear/tough and stocky build
to put on weight/to get fat (a sign of prosperity, so a compliment)
